intro: Dischidia orbicularis, commonly known as the orbicular fig. It is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae, native to Southeast Asia. The plant is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves that are usually orbicular or nearly round in shape. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white in color. Dischidia orbicularis is often grown as a houseplant due to its attractive appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
